title: Retro Dolls Through the Decades
description: From Betsy Wetsy to Chatty Cathy, how well do you remember the dolls that captivated generations of children?

questions.question: Chatty Cathy, the talking doll introduced in 1959, spoke when you did what?
options: Turned a key in her side
Pulled a string on her back

questions.question: The Betsy Wetsy doll, popular in the 1950s, was known for what unique feature?
options: She could drink from a bottle and wet her diaper
She could close her eyes when laid down

questions.question: What was the name of Barbie's boyfriend, introduced by Mattel in 1961?
The Raggedy Ann doll was created by Johnny Gruelle and patented in what year?
Which company manufactured the popular 'Tiny Tears' doll that could cry and blow bubbles?
The Madame Alexander Doll Company was known for creating dolls based on what?
What was the name of Barbie's best friend, introduced in 1963?
Tressy, the popular 1960s doll, was known for what special feature?
options: Her hair grew when you pressed a button

questions.question: The Thumbelina doll, introduced by Ideal in 1961, was special because she could do what?
options: Squirm and move like a real baby

questions.question: What was the name of the baby doll that came with her own carrying case that doubled as a cradle?
Strawberry Shortcake dolls, introduced in 1979, were known for what distinctive feature besides their appearance?
What were the small plastic dolls with oversized colorful hair, introduced by Thomas Dam in the 1960s, called?
The Cabbage Patch Kids were originally called what when their creator, Xavier Roberts, first made them?
Which popular 1980s doll line featured characters like Jem, who was 'truly outrageous'?
Paper dolls with cut-out clothing were hugely popular through the 1950s. Which magazine regularly featured paper doll pages for children?
